J17ExBLqRn5n-bdsvElM5A.text: During my time at "Texas Roadhouse" it was extremely delicious. From the complimentary bread to the grilled shrimp with the bread on the side. The waitress was kind of rude with a hint of sarcasm. But the food was still good!

G_u_MKnRV6Eo6aq7Jxr3sg.text: Not good. Food quality is spotty and going downhill since it opened. Slow service. Questionable management practices. Might want to read up on the #metoo movement.

PX_w-ejPvfvO1d7TwDK_DQ.text: Usually I am a big fan for Texas Roadhouse, but the monroeville location was a high disappointment. During our visit, there were multiple issues encountered. First, the service was significantly slow for not being that busy on a Sunday night. Second, there were multiple issues with the food. The prime rib was not cooked correctly as medium rare was assumed to be medium well done. My wife then ordered shrimp which was completely dry... (how do you mess up shrimp??) Quite personally, if you want to get a good experience, my recommendation is to take the time and drive up to the greensburg location. It is safe to say we will not being driving to the monroeville location anymore.

KF06zKiwrrmMQ4JFcIKVJw.text: The new Texas Roadhouse in Pleasant Hills has opened and I've taken the family there 3 times.  My boys love the steak.  I love the $8.99 early bird specials.  Haven't had a problem yet.  Everyone is so eager to care for the customers.  Hope it stays the nice.  Will be back!

kpkL9P5nbmzGZ-Yq3BkOKA.text: Very disappointed in the ambience, food and service.  The restaurant is divided into sections where a very young receptionist takes you to your booth or in our case made a mistake and had to relocate us.  When you walk in you are greeted by a overwhelmingly number of young employees who appear to be disorganized which I believed to cause the problem in the first place. This place is very casual as is the menu.  We had ordered a filet and a strip which both were over cooked and very small.  The food runner made a error in who got what as it was hard to determine the strip from the filet.  They wait staff also did not inform us that their baked potatoes are drenched in a salt mixture which was so over powering we could not eat them. The original waitress apologized to me as she stated i should  have told you  there was salt on them. My side of mushrooms were soggy as well. With our two glasses of wine and tip, it was around $75 and not worth it.

ddOEXIn75Bz_9bchKse28w.text: The food was good and service was prompt. Isn't a place I would frequent, but the experience was enjoyable.

gP7Lfv3BgWfjq8mJfJbufQ.text: During my ordering of take out, I specifically asked for ketchup for our burgers and fries.  I also asked for a medium well cheeseburger.  Unfortunately, I got neither.   Not only could we not eat our meals, we wasted our money.  Check your take out orders otherwise you may not only end up hungry but also out hard earned cash!!! Never again Texas Roadhouse, Monroeville.

2aeB1saIE7y7zH_0zEeZOg.text: After waiting over an hour for a table we were seated and our orders taken. They were prompt with the appetizer and drinks then it all went downhill! We never saw our server again for a good 20-30 minutes even though he was standing around. When he finally came back ordered a 2nd drink and after about another 20 minutes asked again and watched him put the order in. Meanwhile people around seated at the same time as us were being served and paying. After about 1 hour 40 minutes and 2 starving children we decided to leave. I spoke with the manager after having to interrupt the servers hanging out to go and find one. The manager was unapologetic and all she could say was "do you want me to check on your food"!! I won't be back and unless they change their service they will get more bad reviews.

kWwc3QNrjbAiCGelUSpKpA.text: I love the food steak was very tender,the shrimp is definitely deliciously good been there twice will be going back tomorrow and the waiter name Chris is very pleasant his personality is the best!

UPXXV_03HCkNqp8QpNMSVQ.text: Worst food service EVER. The cheese fell of all my fries, we didn't get every thing we ordered, and when we got the check it took 45 minutes to come back to get the check. Worst birthday experience ever.

C9lO2V2F8BUaD8fDF_JklQ.text: We tried the new Texas Roadhouse in Wilkins Township, had never been to Texas Roadhouse before.  Was very crowded so as we waited we decided to pick out steaks from the window. We received our ticket numbers to our steaks. When we were seated we ordered our iced teas (no lemon) both came with lemon in them; okay no big deal take lemons out. Waitress took orders for our sides as our steaks were already picked out and asked if we wanted anything on our steaks. I replied yes I will take the mushrooms. Husband got his steak said it was perfect.  I got my sides but no steak yet and mine was to be medium rare (his was medium) I ate a roll, nibbled at some corn waiting for my steak. When steak came it had onions, mushrooms and I am not sure what else on it.... Not what I ordered.  Waitress apologized said it was her fault and would get another steak for me; by then the rest of my meal was ice cold.  SO not only did I not get to eat the steak I PICKED OUT ....... BUT bill was not reduced or free dessert or anything offered for their mistake even if I would have said do not worry about it , a good run restaurant offers to compensate for their mistakes.

1Zkzgc6i4IiO2k-izWRlGw.text: Best restaurant in Monroeville.  Family friendly atmosphere, great food and awesome service.  Christian was our server tonight,  he was exceptional, we will be back and we will ask for Christian!

rcKwAhFfOBlxeePdrJ_j8g.text: They DANCE FOR YOU!!!!!  How is that not awesome!?!?!??!!!  Booooooooo!!!!!....!!!!!.....!!!!....  To whoever gives this place a low rating! Granted... The weekend staff is a bit different than the weekday staff. Some people definitely are there just because "it's a job".  You get that wherever you go though. I'm sure everybody can pretend to be happy in place where everyone makes $30/hr just for smiling and serving people...........  This is not that place. It is awesome though.

1N6Y3Z-bZV-WE_ITpX36nQ.text: We had a party of 10 and they were super accommodating on a busy Sunday evening. The hostesses and waitresses were super friendly and very attentive. It was my father-in-law's birthday and they came and sang and made him sit on a saddle.   All-around we had a very pleasurable experience and we must say that we have never been disappointed at any of their locations.  Texas roadhouse always seems to be well staffed and well-trained. That goes along way in adding to a pleasurable experience. We never went more than a few minutes without the waitress coming to our table asking us if we were okay or if we needed anything. We'll be back.

RAiYMOAzZ6zRYgWW7rpsig.text: Our experience was very bad to say the least. I took my mom here and the chicken wasn't done. The waitress was nice enough to send the food back and when my mom got her replacement, it was still pink on the inside. The waitress compensated us again and told my mom to pick something on the menu to get instead. She choose a cheeseburger. When she got the food it was a pulled pork sandwich. My mom gave up and just took it. The cooks there don't know how to read orders apparently because they messed up 3 times in a row.

GlHeB_lAVI6i56juNZ2GBQ.text: The customer service is the very worst of any restaurant l have visited in a while.subpar. The greeting staff is very unprofessional For an hour wait, customers deserve better.

27n1CoR87tYeb2Z5YUalvw.text: I took my lovely niece to eat at Texas Roadhouse for late night dinner because she's never been. While eating we heard yelling and screaming in the back.  I assume it was an irate customers.  It turned out to be 2 employees arguing and using profanity in the back.  When I say arguing, I mean yelling to the point where it sounded like a fight was about to happen.  It slightly frightened my niece.  She was concerned and so was I.  My niece got out of her seat and sat beside me and said "I'm ready to go!"  This really saddens me that my niece had to experience this on her first trip to TX Roadhouse.  I didn't pay for her to come hear employees argue.  I would expect behavior like this from customers because the population of people change from day-to-day... BUT EMPLOYEES!  Why ruin your reputation like that... was it worth it?  Besides that altercation, my waiter was very pleasant and checked on us frequently.  My food came out warm... i prefer piping hot so i know it's cooked fresh but i was so tired I didn't feel like asking them to heat it up.  Despite that, the meat was very moist and tasty and the green beans and mash were good!  They lose a star due to lack of professionalism and warm food.  I'm sure my experience will be better next time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ysCJZhBxhlOKz6P5jL66zg.text: I travel the country and i would have to say that this was the worst experience I have had at a Texas Roadhouse.   I ate at the bar and ordered my steak before a guy who came in and sat down next to me.  Our salads came out at the same time, which is not a big deal.   However, he was served his steak a full 29 mins before my steak was delivered.   He was literally finished by the time my steak arrived.    Granted the young lady was in the weeds, but the inept manager did not send her any help after she came out to check on her.  I couldn't get her attention to even order another beer.  My steak came out over cooked.  And the manager did come out and asked me "how was  everything?"  I told her "late" she laughed and said they were very busy.  I will not be back to this establishment.

vbYPXj6454HXqnXl-tekNA.text: Came here for dinner with my boyfriend and used call ahead seating.  Got to the restaurant and waited for about 25 minutes.  Got seated, ordered and salads came out very quickly.  Multiple people were seated after us and received their meals in a timely manner.  Unfortunately we waited for about an hour when our waitress finally came over and said she apologized for the wait and alerted the manager.  The manager approached us and apologized for the wait and gave us a discount on our bill.  Very professional and polite.  We waited for another 15 minutes and our waitress brought our food.  Which were BOTH the wrong orders.  I ordered chicken and received beef, he ordered a filet Mignon and received a sirloin.  I finally received the right order after sending mine back but he did not.  They also charged us for the filet on the bill.  I appreciate the manager trying to make it right but in all honesty we will not be returning.

6UsIFt9aBZYOQzsBRhVx-g.text: Well this is the second time I've ate at this particular one.   First experience wasn't great but I try not to leave a bad review on one experience   Everyone has a bad day.  But second time.  Showed up 7:30 at night on a Sunday.  Not very busy.  No wait for the bar.   Bartender was super in-personable and just frankly kind of rude.   Tried to order the Dallas fillet they were out.  Okay order the prim rib.  They're out. Then I settle for the ribeye with a salad and cream corn. Guess what.  They're out of corn.  Get my dinner.  Never got my salad.   Never got a refill on the drink.  Ordered a rattlesnake bite before we ordered food and guess what.  Come to find out they're out.  Get the potato skin instead and we get it literally got it when we finished our steaks.  Will not be returning to this location and literally hope this place fails as this is the kind of establishment that should.  I've ate at several Texas Roadhouse and this is horrible.

1rQ0gdgTrgqDQavQHKgg2g.text: Okay, not bad, not bad. Great fun restaurant with good menu, fun ambiance and good service. Been a TRH in Cleveland many times while working there on business. This is the firs time for me in the Pittsburgh area and specifically in Monroeville. This place opened not more than a month ago. In that time they have worked through most of the 'opening day' issues and troubles.  I used the 'call ahead seating' option and was seated within 5 minutes of arriving. That is good system management let's just say. We were seated in a booth in the bar area, which was just fine with us. Our server/waiter was very professional and cordial and prompt with his attention and service. We had three different stake selection all of which came out just a tad over done but very tasty nonetheless. The sides are 'kind-of' 'homestyle' but adequate accompaniment's to the main portion of the mean which is steak; which is why everybody is here.  The menu is quite varied and offer may choices from ribs, to burgers to many kinds of steaks. I think everybody could find something interesting to eat here. Everything is moderately priced and full of flavor.  Left well satiated and happy. We will be back for more.

pGxX6yLadeNmyMXkR9CJug.text: Prices are good, but steak overdone.  Have visited twice, and both times the steaks were not prepared as ordered.  Good service - friendly servers.

INBWXs6OfiGe0JtgvfLnwQ.text: Took 31 minutes for my steak to arrive and then it was not done as requested, had to send back. They weren't that busy either. When I went to use the restroom while waiting, the staff removed my beverage and bread. Overall poor service & mediocre food.

KCQH6BtqfrPw9ocWlKcKBQ.text: I love Country Fried Steak! Few do it better! Real steak, awesome white gravy! Would give 5  except for the disappointing portion of mashed potatoes, and overall food temperature. Side salad also very satisfying (I recommend the Honey Mustard dressing)! Next visit I won't pass up my favorite appetizer: the blooming onion!

s2NWYrMAy9KcM5E5F-APCw.text: Was a bad night from the moment we set down, buns where room temp, but hey things happen no biggie.  Then my Chili comes but not my wifes salad, no waitress for 10 min, I am done with Chili she stops and ask if my wife ever got her salad (do you see a plate).  Then she brings salad and 10 seconds later the food shows up, not delivered by our waitress, but that is no big deal.  Wife cuts steak to see if done the way she wants, we are good to go, we start to eat, my ribs are cold.  I sit the ribs at the end of the table to alert the waitress, we don't see her for 15 Mins, finally ask for a manager, all down hill from there.  I email the GM/Owner NO response.  GREAT WAY TO TREAT CUSTOMERS

lw0OUx_V5sfku26etAA3vw.text: My review is probably biased. This is not my type of restaurant to start off. However, if you like loud and obnoxious type of restaurant settings then this is the restaurant for you. It was very chaotic and I wasn't fan of the demographic of people. It seemed that it was only older caucasians that came here and were looking at me at a very judging manor. Also, there is a long wait even if you call ahead so beware. I don't think I will come back.       On the otherhand, from what I ordered-the rattlesnake bites and brownie were very good. The rattlesnake bites doesn't actually have rattlesnake and they are basically fried cheese and jalapeno balls but the cheese is gooey and melts deliciously. The brownie is a hot brownie with ice cream and is very good. However, I got the pulled pork dinner for my main meal and to be frank, it was mediocre. I would recommend Pittsburgh Barbecue Company over Texas Roadhouse.

GZmZJQnx8K9mFK0ZKg0k-w.text: I.  Love.  The.  Food.  Out.  Here.  And.  The.  Cheesecake.  Was.  Awesome.  Im.  Here.  For.  Mother's. Day.  Dinner.  I.  Enjoy.  Every.  Bit.  Of.  It.  To.  I'll.  Come.  Again.

3gbLE_bU9UpqiDLzMvdmcA.text: Very nice atmosphere, and a good family restaurant. Not good at accommodating large groups, and the Ribs and steak fries were mediocre at best. Otherwise a good place to eat. Short wait for food and drinks, appetizers came within 5 minutes.

zKI-79BLPKbikwk09HUMRg.text: Texas Roadhouse gets 5 stars all because the 2 bartenders DJ and Anton! They were amazing! Friendly, attentive, and hardworking. They made our dining and drinking experience pleasurable.

GYwxBEvNmxb5cQwgkaW8yA.text: This location is really not great at all.  I just don't think the bartender should be eating behind the bar in front of customers.  The bartender also made it clear at 930pm that they were closing soon.    Not impressed with Staff this location has.  Other Texas Roadhouse locations are SO MUCH better!

EbqYh4kWeO6Kt3T7DBDP8w.text: I ordered to go from here a few days ago and was so happy I did! I got the Road Kill (chopped steak) with extra mushrooms and it was so delicious. I am pretty sure I could make an entire meal off of just the mushrooms, they were unreal good. The rolls are always warm and fluffy. This is my new go to place!

6w1Ve0lds49w2WFyGoIVHg.text: Was my first time at any Texas Roadhouse, went in with low expectations, but left very happy.  Love the bread and the peanuts.  The waiter is very friendly and entertaining.  The order was accurate and delicious.  All pretty reasonably priced, and left feeling very full.  I'll definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uWu5ulYcS41o9xCjgQCQzQ.text: I've had mixed experiences at this location.  One time we went and were seated promptly, served efficiently and everything in our meal was delicious and correct.  Another time we were there our server clearly didn't want to be working, screwed up our order and took over 45 minutes to get our food.   One time it was just average.  Longer than expected wait times but food and refills were timely.  There would be a higher rating if the service and quality were more consistent.  I have just been surprised that we've had such varied experiences, especially since we are usually there around the same times (weeknight or weekend evenings). Overall, we enjoy the place.  There is a decent variety on the menu, a large seating area and tasty peanuts and bread/butter.  And when the food is prepared correctly, it is quite tasty.  But when they are off, they seem to be really off. The pros are that it is kid friendly for a variety of reasons (including how loud it is, so if you have a kid doing crazy things it isn't as noticeable as in quieter establishments).  Cons include unpredictable wait times for tables and food and service.   We'll probably only be back when organizations we support have fundraiser nights or when we get the free kids meal coupons.

meG1jyCgOOrDsmqAP_3Wfw.text: Nothing remarkable that would have me thinking I would go back. The food is so-so. My husband had a burger and it was so dry and no taste. I would think "meat" is their specialty.  This is second time we tried it and had the same feeling when we left. Too many really good restaurants in the area rather than waste money here.

ws5DhHVSB32rsRS-iYIVUA.text: Stopped here the other day with my 12 year old son...we had a hankering for ribs, and I didn't feel like cooking. We were seated quickly and the server took our drink and food order quickly. It was a bit past 8 on a Sunday evening. The ribs came out without much delay. They had a "cooked a good while ago and kept in a warmer" look to them, but they tasted okay and pulled easily from the bone. Sides were okay, except for the steak fries I never got. Unfortunately there was a group of younger millenial types seated adjacent to us, one of whom was flamboyantly sure he was absolutely fascinating and everyone in the place should be treated to his often vulgar exploits and opinions. Neither the waitress nor management made any effort to restrain his offensive commentary or volume. In an already loud-ish venue, it just made for an unpleasant experience. Food - passable. Service - friendly but busy enough that attention to detail lost. Atmosphere - unmonitored. Overall...meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FJajKUiwP2ddkaZg8OxZ_Q.text: Went here today at 7:30 pm 12/14 to celebrate work accomplishments with the family with beverages and steaks and left disappointed.   Ordered 2 Porterhouses - I ordered one medium well with mushrooms and onions and my husband ordered the other medium.   The steak I thought was mine was delivered and it was a perfectly cooked medium well steak and a decent cut of meat.   However, My husband's steak which was supposed to be cooked medium and was delivered over cooked and much smaller than mine. He tried eating the side of the porterhouse less over cooked and appeared very unhappy with his food trying to force it down. I asked to try a piece and it was not as tasty as my own with a lot of fat and was over cooked and chewy. He tried my steak which I had just started eating and we assumed that they switched our steaks placing the mushrooms on the medium steak. We thought they mixed up the steaks.   I switched steaks with my hubby and dumped the mushrooms and onions on and I could not eat it. Especially since the other was cooked much better!It did not taste good at all and chewy. Very over cooked with a lot of fat!   I told the waitress and she understood the mixup and the dissatisfaction with the food and she took it back.   The manager came back and told us that someone In the back felt that we ate too much of the bad steak and that they would not replace it and would have to charge us to replace it since it looked like a bunch was eaten; which was not True - the steak was very small - however her solution proposed was to take the good much bigger steak cooked perfect steak and swap it and replace that one - which made no sense. And who knows what spit would have made it on our food so we declined. We left the bad steak on the table just the way you see on the picture.   We were not pleased and was dissatisfied that the manager had such a lack of care.   The waitress was awesome and sent many apologies - much more caring than the manager. She understood. We left her a tip for her services and are however, we are still disappointed with the porterhouse steak issue left unresolved thanks to the manager.   We will not be back to this restaurant and have the same bad taste in our mouths that we had with the nasty, tough and fatty porterhouse steak served to us.   Tip: taste your food and are displeased, stop eating it - don't settle if it is less than expected and return it for a refund right away. Don't waste your time. We work hard or our money and you deserve and expect quality food and a resolution if you report issues.   Experienced was ruined.   Spend the extra on Morton's and Capital Grill. This would never happen there. Save your pennies!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KC_TU3JwTNvLKIuyunPY7w.text: We had a party of 7 and the waitress did a great job taking our orders and making sure we were taken care of. Food was great and so were the margaritas!   Highly obsessed with their bread and butter I could eat it all day! Plus you can't go wrong with free peanuts!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SLTr9W-RcRQdhfP04KB8TA.text: Always great, simple food.  Active atmosphere. They give you a TON of food, so come hungry and ready to chow down.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skinny Margarita with shot of patron
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Onion appetizer
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rolls with cinnamon butter

FQciV1pfscYZj3SE_I1Uhw.text: Our first visit to the New Texas Roadhouse in Wilkins Township wasn't as I expected. We love the Texas Roadhouse In Greensburg and was hoping to have the same experience. It was horrible. First time mishaps  Our second outing was Wonderful! Gabriella was wonderful attentive and a great server.  Food was out timely, as was ordered and hot.  We highly recommend and excited a Texas Roadhouse is so close to home !!  We will return !! Ask for Gabriella you won't be disappointed!!

cBaqWaDjHOXx1FeHcCxrbQ.text: They go big in Texas and this place proves that point! You get a big, nice portion and soft yeast buns with cinnamon butter to compliment your entree. I especially like the fried catfish filets, which are well seasoned and crunchy. The ribs have a nice sweet sauce and fall off the bone texture. The house salad is more than just lettuce and tomatoes! The hotdog from the kids menu is huge. This is the place to go if you're hungry or want dinner and leftovers for the next day! Prices are reasonable considering the quantity and flavors. Hope they never change this formula because it works and the crowd will continue to rally hear for chow!

4Eosun-XVu2tE7mEJfCeDw.text: We came here for a post-Christmas family dinner after some shopping at the mall. This restaurant has been open for about 3 weeks now; we normally go to the one in Greensburg. The wait time provided to us was pretty accurate. We were told 25 minutes, and we were seated within 30 minutes. The waiting area could be a little bigger as I'm pretty sure the Greensburg one is.   Naturally, we ordered the Cactus Blossom, and it was amazing. Crunchy battered-covered onions with zesty horseradish sauce! We saw other tables order the potato skins which looked super tasty as well. While the rolls and honey butter were good, we could've used more butter but we made it work. My sister ordered a strawberry margarita ($9.25) that I finished off, and it was fantastic! I ordered the steak and shrimp combo ($17.99). The shrimp was so full of flavor and spice. However, I asked for my steak well done and it still had pink inside. I was too full to eat it anyway so I packed it up to further cook at home.   Our waitress was very friendly and on top of things. Before my dad even finished his strawberry lemonade, she brought out another. Well worth the $2.99! I must admit that I was disheartened when our waitress mentioned that they could not take lunch breaks or eat at the restaurant during their shifts due to the busyness. I'm a firm believer in taking care of your employees.   Other than the couple things that I mentioned, we enjoyed our meal at the new Texas Roadhouse in Monroeville.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

n5yxaqRQ4LAqQkOKh_0iNw.text: Love the bone in ribeye but they never cook it properly. It's such a huge portion I take it home so I simply eat the outer portion and take the center home so I can put it in the oven to finish cooking. The sides, bread and drinks are always on point. I don't care for the birthday celebration but I simply ignore it. Seems like there are multiple birthdays whenever I go. Highly recommend calling ahead for a table. The restaurant is not big enough in my opinion so it gets crowded fast. I wish they took advantage of the much larger empty properties in Monroeville.

WTUWQi2qeIsDuwqx_lF96A.text: Can only review on the drinks. Cabernet not so tasty and on the expensive side. Blue Moon ok. That being said, the house is full and all look happy. Everyone spoke and all have a smile. Free parking is always a plus. Looked at the menu and it is reasonably priced so a family can dine, have fun and not break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Texas pour cabernet and a Moon Blue

f5h52ucW_M04KirRSTRBTQ.text: If I could give it less than one star I would. We arrived at the Monroeville/Wilkins location and were seated at 5:55 p.m. By 6:25 p.m. we still had not been waited on. Several wait staff passed by our table, they didn't even acknowledge us. The restaurant was not crowded at all. In fact the section we were seated in had only one other occupied table when we arrived. When people that came in after us were given drinks and had orders taken, that was enough.   We walked out and asked to speak with the manager. When we explained what we had experienced, her reply was sorry I didn't know. That was it. No offer to take us back to our table and get us waited on right away. Nothing. We will never go back, and will discourage others from going to the Monroeville/Wilkins location.

7_ZJIQKFthhAzVaSMZWb_w.text: We were here in Easter Sunday. It was strange for us to be in a restaurant on a family holiday, but that's how the cards landed. And we were not alone. They were swamped!  We were seated quickly. Out came water and bread. Bread was delicious.   Order placed, Hubs had giant chops but was a little disappointed in flavor. "A little bland" was the  gravy report.   I had a lovely N.Y. strip that was done perfectly.   And the server waited until I cut into it before leaving. I love that idea. If it would've been wrong, no waiting for me. Also, if I would've gobbled it down and THEN claimed it was wrong, no food payment scene after the fact for them.   It was a busy afternoon at a busy chain on a busy holiday weekend. Their prices are fair and we were fed. Done deal, no surprises and everyone was happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

u6kq3enHo2nBrtzS-WInOA.text: When we came in there was a little wait no problem. Then we got to pick out steak with a free smothering. Our waitress gave me the evil eye as soon as we started to sit down. Drinks came quickly and they were delicious. My salad had the heart of the lettuce all thru it with the bitter part of the seams. My steak was prepared perfectly. The waitress though I'm pretty sure is having a bad day

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hurricane Marg and fruity frozen peach marg
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dDVTNylDnDz0hGrYHwypkA.text: Pros:  -those rolls! OMG the rolls! The butter is a delightful concoction of cinnamon sugar and the rolls themselves are golden, soft and glazed with...butter! So good! No need for an appetizer -food and side dishes were all surprisingly well seasoned and hit all the right taste buds. My country fried chicken was perfectly crispy and my hubby's order of steak medallions were hella tasty! Even his green beans were juicy and filled with bacon bits. Mmmmm...You won't get innovation but you will get satisfaction here -waitresses here were really personable and friendly.  -ambiance is pretty dark and a little obnoxious with all the random yelling and dancing. As a novelty, it was fun at first but I can see how it gets old real fast.  Cons: -this must be the only place people from a 15-mile radius eat out at. We actually had to go to another restaurant this one Sunday night because it was just too packed. We ended up picking a Wednesday night but lo and behold, there was another 35-min wait! I tried calling ahead but their phone lines were down that day :(. The message on the line also said they don't take reservations. The popularity here is a little ridiculous. I guess if I come here again, it'll have to be on a Monday at 4pm or something.

d3KvOLAFR7ZqLOnf4XSYJA.text: On the bread alone I'm coming back here. I was super excited to find out we had a Texas Roadhouse nearby. I don't even eat steak but I enjoy their grilled shrimp or even their chicken fingers. The staff here were awesome even when they unfortunately ran out of bread. I recovered though when they gave us some on the way out. The cocktails are colorful and if you go for wine don't play yourself and go for the Texas pour because why not? I haven't met a Texas Roadhouse I didn't like and they're consistent I will give them that.

oZaEGq0jmFY9J4SpGDB4hA.text: As a Texan spending a month in Pennsylvania I was sure glad to see Texas Roadhose Restaurants here. Came in about 3:00 pm today and we were seated immediately. Our awesome server Jayla was with us pretty quickly and was very patient with my husband who has aphasia. There was a small mix up on my salad but it was easily and quickly fixed. Our steaks (11 oz. sirloins) were nice cuts and cooked perfectly. The only "problem" I have as a Texan is that they do not have Dr. Pepper, a Texas made soft drink.

ntOzFjDufNilUuMp-W9F0g.text: My family's favorite place to eat!! Always  order the steak and rib combo it's delicious!! Great food and service.

OMdZMJnia0_IrjQ6okL7MQ.text: This bone in ribeye steak was fire! I don't eat steak often, but when I do it has to be right. For the few times I have gone to any Texas Roadhouse I have never been let down. The staff and the cooks get an A+ in my book.  The portions and seasoning of the food is on point. Then to top it off the adult beverages is on the money. I always eat good, but have yet to get dessert. Because by the time I finish my meal I am stuffed . So if you ever want to treat yourself to a good meal or gather you friends up to enjoy a good meal, music and drinks this is your go to! The only thing you will regret is not being able to order desert because your so full!!
